<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Soulsight](/Feats.aspx?ID=1647) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 113 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[[Sorcerer](/Classes.aspx?ID=11)] bloodline that grants [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) or [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120) spells

</column>

---

Your muse has opened your senses to the world beyond. You gain spiritsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet. Spiritsense enables you to sense the spirits of creatures, including living creatures, most non-mindless [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), and [haunts](/Traits.aspx?ID=88) within the listed range. As with your hearing and other imprecise senses, you still need to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) to locate an undetected creature. As spiritsense detects spiritual essence, not physical bodies, it can detect spirits projected by spells such as [_project image_](/Spells.aspx?ID=237) or possessing otherwise soulless objects. It can't detect soulless bodies, [constructs](/Traits.aspx?ID=35), or objects, and like most senses, it doesn't penetrate through solid objects.

<title level="2">Soulsight leads to...</title>
[Shared Sight](/Feats.aspx?ID=3642)
name: Soulsight
prerequisite: [Sorcerer] bloodline that grants divine or occult spells
